text: Vityazevo () is a rural locality (a selo) in Vityazevsky Rural Okrug under the administrative jurisdiction of the Town of Anapa in Krasnodar Krai, Russia, located north of Anapa proper on a bank of the Vityazevsky liman. Population: ==History== The stanitsa of Vityazevskaya, named after Major Vityaz, existed in this location from 1837 to 1862. In 1862, it became the settlement of Vityazevskoye. Vityazevo had urban-type settlement status until January 1, 2005. ==Sights and recreation== The "Paralia" embankment The "Paralia" embankment, built in ancient Greek style, is the main attraction in Vityazevo. Vityazevo has a beach, which is about wide. Vityazevo is also known for its peloids. Vityazevo is surrounded by vineyards and has a winery. ==References== Category:Rural localities in Krasnodar Krai
title: Vityazevo, Krasnodar Krai
